title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: More than two dozen volunteers from Pine Street Inn distributed supplies and offered rides to shelters during Boston's blizzard.
Pine Street Inn shelters, with a capacity of 585 beds, housed upwards of 660 people amidst the severe weather.
The outreach efforts saw fewer on the streets, a positive sign that many opted for indoor shelters during the storm.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Over 50% of flights from Boston Logan Airport were canceled for Tuesday due to a nor'easter.
Nearly 270 flights scheduled to depart Logan Tuesday were canceled, impacting travel plans significantly.
Amtrak suspended service between Boston and New York but aims to restore it for Tuesday morning.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins are considering trading Viktor Arvidsson before the NHL's March 6 trade deadline.
Arvidsson, acquired for a 2027 fifth-round pick, has 14 goals and 28 points in 45 games this season.
The Bruins could retain Arvidsson for a playoff push as they hold a final Wild Card spot with 61% playoff odds.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Over 30 inches of snow prompts widespread school closures in Massachusetts on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
Major districts like Boston, Cambridge, and Worcester are among those closed due to the snowstorm.
Several districts, including Athol-Royalston, Littleton, and Lunenburg, are operating on delayed schedules.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown initially disliked Mike Vrabel, writing 'I hate Vrabel' in his notebook during meetings with the Tennessee Titans.
Brown shared how Vrabel's coaching style, emphasizing accountability and engagement, transformed his perspective from hatred to respect.
Brown is currently under contract with the Eagles, but speculation exists about a potential trade to the Patriots.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The U.S. women's hockey team declined President Trump's State of the Union invitation due to scheduling conflicts.
Trump invited both the U.S. women's and men's teams after their gold medal wins over Canada in Milan.
US men's team celebrated their win with Trump on a call; some players expected at the State of the Union.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots released running back Antonio Gibson, freeing up over $3 million in cap space for the 2026 season.
Gibson, recovering from a torn ACL, had no guaranteed money left on his contract with New England.
Gibson contributed 644 rushing yards and was a top kick returner, recording a touchdown in the 2025 season.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in parts of Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, on Monday morning.
Blizzards feature low visibility under 1/4 mile for over three hours with winds of 35 mph or higher.
The National Weather Service warned of hazardous travel, whiteout conditions, and potential power outages due to strong winds.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Jack Coen captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston with fierce winds and near-whiteout conditions.
Snowfall reached about 14 inches in Pawtucket, R.I. while Boston braces for 18 to 24 inches.
National Weather Service warns of dangerous heavy snowfall and damaging wind gusts across Massachusetts.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Randy Orton wants to use his RKO wrestling move on Tom Brady after Brady called WWE 'cute' on a podcast.
Tom Brady will participate in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic with NFL stars like Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski.
Orton competes in his record 10th WWE Elimination Chamber match, aiming for Wrestlemania 42 against champion Drew McIntyre.
